_description: On the natures of the Twelve Signs — four quatrains at the end of a prose tract on this subject

BodAsh191IV.First Lines:
Doctouris wordis þat mou not varieseien þat Aries leo
                    & Sagittarie…
BodAsh191IV.Last Lines:
…And as bokys us ensureseptemtrional of þeir
                    nature
BodAsh191IV.Note:
Written as prose; divided into four quatrains with subtitles: ‘Est
                    parte’, ‘South parte’, ‘West parte’, ‘North
                    parte’.

BodAsh391II.First Lines:
DOctours woordes mowe not variseyen þat aries leo and
                    sagittari…
BodAsh391II.Last Lines:
…And as bookes vs ensureSeptentrional of þaire
                    nature
BodAsh391II.Editions:
Mooney,  Linne R. 
             “Practical Didactic Works in Middle English.” 
         Diss. Toronto, 1981: 276-8.

BodAsh1393.First Lines:
…tores woordes þat mow not warreSeyhtte þat Aries
                    leo & sagittarySeyht Theis synys ben in es ynesspiciallColoryke
                    fier yn the orientall…
BodAsh1393.Last Lines:
…And of lookes vs ynsewyreSeptem trianall of ther
                    nature
BodAsh1393.Note:
Each stanza with heading, as for the first, ‘Este whoot &
                    dry’.

BodArcSelSup90.First Lines:
Doctouris wordis þat mou not varieSeien þat aries leo
                    & sagitarie…
BodArcSelSup90.Last Lines:
…And as bokis vs ensureSeptemtrional al þeir
                    nature

BLCottVitAI.First Lines:
[D]octouris wordis þat mou not varieSeien þat aries leo
                    & sagittarie…
BLCottVitAI.Last Lines:
…And as bookis us ensureSeptemtrional of her
                    nature
BLCottVitAI.Note:
Space was left for an enlarged initial ‘D’, which was left
                    blank.
